application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONARA Name: St Andrews Square Conservation Area
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

decision_conditions: The tree is showing no signs of ill health, has not grown substantially in a number of years and while growing with a heavy lean, the amount of canopy is not so excessive to require drastic reduction works. The tree is also in a sheltered position and not unduly subjected to strong winds, it is healthy and its shape is quite usual for the species. As the canopy is fairly small for a Pine, the amount's proposed for removal are significant and unwarranted.This was a Conservation Area Notification but has changed to a TPO works application as the Council have served a TPO within the 6 week time frame in order to prevent the works as provided for in law.
description: T.1 Scots pine - 2-2.5m Lateral reduction of 4 branches on the leaning side to suitable growth points.
